documents.content: A 500 nm ultra-broadband laser covering wavelengths of 700-1200 nm is built as a seed for the prototype facility of a near-single-cycle petawatt laser project that will use wide-angle non-collinear optical parametric chirped pulse amplification (WNOPCPA). Multiple thin-plate compression and optical

metadata.title: Compact 500 nm ultra-broadband seed laser for WNOPCPA prototype facility.
metadata.authors: Li Z; Leng Y; Li R

documents.content: pulse amplification (WNOPCPA). Multiple thin-plate compression and optical parametric amplification are used to create the ultra-broadband spectrum and amplify the newly generated spectra, especially those far away from that of the driving laser, respectively. The driving laser is a sub-picosecond

metadata.title: Compact 500 nm ultra-broadband seed laser for WNOPCPA prototype facility.
metadata.authors: Li Z; Leng Y; Li R

documents.content: of the driving laser, respectively. The driving laser is a sub-picosecond Yb:YAG laser with a full-width bandwidth of ∼20 nm centered at 1030 nm, and the output spectral bandwidth is ∼500 nm (∼700-1200 nm), showing a spectral broadening of ∼25 times.

metadata.title: Compact 500 nm ultra-broadband seed laser for WNOPCPA prototype facility.
metadata.authors: Li Z; Leng Y; Li R

documents.content: Defect-assisted Auger recombination in graphitic carbon nitride (CN) is systematically elucidated using excitation-density-dependent femtosecond transient absorption spectroscopy (fs-TAS). The band-edge state of CN is demonstrated to exhibit a twofold degeneracy, originating from electronic

metadata.title: Defect-assisted Auger recombination in graphitic carbon nitride revealed by excitation-density-dependent transient absorption spectroscopy.
metadata.authors: Gao T; Wei Z; Gao S; Shi J; Sun J

documents.content: demonstrated to exhibit a twofold degeneracy, originating from electronic transitions between symmetry-equivalent exciton states formed by conjugated π-orbitals. Quantitative analysis of the π-orbital exciton recombination kinetics by a rate equation resolves three distinct photocarrier relaxation

metadata.title: Defect-assisted Auger recombination in graphitic carbon nitride revealed by excitation-density-dependent transient absorption spectroscopy.
metadata.authors: Gao T; Wei Z; Gao S; Shi J; Sun J

documents.content: by a rate equation resolves three distinct photocarrier relaxation pathways: monomolecular trapping, bimolecular recombination, and defect-assisted Auger recombination. The photocarrier kinetics accelerates nonlinearly as the excitation densities increase, revealing the dominance of the Auger

metadata.title: Defect-assisted Auger recombination in graphitic carbon nitride revealed by excitation-density-dependent transient absorption spectroscopy.
metadata.authors: Gao T; Wei Z; Gao S; Shi J; Sun J

documents.content: as the excitation densities increase, revealing the dominance of the Auger recombination under intense photoexcitation. Notably, the extracted Auger recombination coefficient on thermally treated CN (TTCN) is significantly reduced by an order of magnitude compared to that of pristine CN (PCN),

metadata.title: Defect-assisted Auger recombination in graphitic carbon nitride revealed by excitation-density-dependent transient absorption spectroscopy.
metadata.authors: Gao T; Wei Z; Gao S; Shi J; Sun J

documents.content: reduced by an order of magnitude compared to that of pristine CN (PCN), mainly attributing to the deactivation of the defect states by crystallinity enhancement. These findings establish a comprehensive kinetic framework for defect-mediated Auger recombination in graphitic CN, offering critical

metadata.title: Defect-assisted Auger recombination in graphitic carbon nitride revealed by excitation-density-dependent transient absorption spectroscopy.
metadata.authors: Gao T; Wei Z; Gao S; Shi J; Sun J

documents.content: for defect-mediated Auger recombination in graphitic CN, offering critical guidance to advance its applications for photoelectric conversion.

metadata.title: Defect-assisted Auger recombination in graphitic carbon nitride revealed by excitation-density-dependent transient absorption spectroscopy.
metadata.authors: Gao T; Wei Z; Gao S; Shi J; Sun J

documents.content: We demonstrate the design and optimization of on-chip arbitrary dispersion profiles using deep photonic networks constructed from custom-designed Mach-Zehnder interferometers (MZIs). These photonic networks employ optimizable waveguide tapers, enabling precise engineering of wavelength-dependent

metadata.title: On-chip arbitrary dispersion engineering with deep photonic networks.
metadata.authors: Gorgulu K; Deniz Vit A; Najjar Amiri A; Salih Magden E

documents.content: waveguide tapers, enabling precise engineering of wavelength-dependent dispersion profiles. We experimentally demonstrate a proof-of-concept two-port photonic network that exhibits a highly nonintuitive triangular dispersion profile over the wavelength range of 1.54 μm-1.58 μm while simultaneously

metadata.title: On-chip arbitrary dispersion engineering with deep photonic networks.
metadata.authors: Gorgulu K; Deniz Vit A; Najjar Amiri A; Salih Magden E

documents.content: profile over the wavelength range of 1.54 μm-1.58 μm while simultaneously achieving a flatband transmission with an insertion loss of less than 0.7 dB. We also illustrate the potential of multi-port photonic networks to enhance design freedom for more complex and customizable dispersion profiles,

metadata.title: On-chip arbitrary dispersion engineering with deep photonic networks.
metadata.authors: Gorgulu K; Deniz Vit A; Najjar Amiri A; Salih Magden E

documents.content: design freedom for more complex and customizable dispersion profiles, enabling new possibilities for on-chip dispersion engineering.

metadata.title: On-chip arbitrary dispersion engineering with deep photonic networks.
metadata.authors: Gorgulu K; Deniz Vit A; Najjar Amiri A; Salih Magden E

documents.content: In this Letter, double resonant quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy (QEPAS) with a spherical resonator is proposed for the first time to our knowledge. This spherical resonator, which functions both as an acoustic resonator and a gas chamber, facilitates efficient sound wave coupling between

metadata.title: Double resonant quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy with a spherical resonator.
metadata.authors: Zhang C; Qiao S; He Y; Ma Y

documents.content: and a gas chamber, facilitates efficient sound wave coupling between the resonator and the quartz tuning fork (QTF), enabling double resonance. The frequency response and acoustic field distribution of the radial spherical resonator were calculated using the finite element method. The radius of the

metadata.title: Double resonant quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy with a spherical resonator.
metadata.authors: Zhang C; Qiao S; He Y; Ma Y

documents.content: were calculated using the finite element method. The radius of the spherical resonator was optimized to 27.34 mm to realize perfect resonance coupling with the QTF. A novel T-tip QTF with a low resonance frequency of 8.97 kHz was positioned at the center of the spherical resonator to detect the

metadata.title: Double resonant quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy with a spherical resonator.
metadata.authors: Zhang C; Qiao S; He Y; Ma Y

documents.content: was positioned at the center of the spherical resonator to detect the photoacoustic signal though its piezoelectric effect and resonance characteristics. Acetylene (C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub>) and methane (CH<sub>4</sub>) were selected as target gases to evaluate the performance of the QEPAS

metadata.title: Double resonant quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy with a spherical resonator.
metadata.authors: Zhang C; Qiao S; He Y; Ma Y

documents.content: were selected as target gases to evaluate the performance of the QEPAS sensor. Experimental results showed that incorporating the spherical resonator enhanced the 2f signal amplitudes by factors of 13.03 and 13.29 for the C2H2-QEPAS and CH4-QEPAS systems,

metadata.title: Double resonant quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy with a spherical resonator.
metadata.authors: Zhang C; Qiao S; He Y; Ma Y

documents.content: for the C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub>-QEPAS and CH<sub>4</sub>-QEPAS systems, respectively. The long-term stability and optimal detection performance of the designed sensor were evaluated using Allan deviation analysis. The designed QEPAS sensor achieved minimum detection limits (MDLs) of 337.2 ppb

metadata.title: Double resonant quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy with a spherical resonator.
metadata.authors: Zhang C; Qiao S; He Y; Ma Y

documents.content: QEPAS sensor achieved minimum detection limits (MDLs) of 337.2 ppb for C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub> and 422 ppb for CH<sub>4</sub> at average times of 900 s and 1000 s, respectively.

metadata.title: Double resonant quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy with a spherical resonator.
metadata.authors: Zhang C; Qiao S; He Y; Ma Y

documents.content: Methane (CH<sub>4</sub>), as a critical greenhouse gas and explosive hazard, demands highly sensitive detection for environmental monitoring and industrial safety. To address the limitation of its slow relaxation in quartz-enhanced photoacoustic spectroscopy (QEPAS), this paper reported a novel

metadata.title: Acetylene-enhanced methane-QEPAS sensing.
metadata.authors: Sun J; He Y; Qiao S; Zhang C; Ma Y

documents.content: photoacoustic spectroscopy (QEPAS), this paper reported a novel acetylene (C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub>)-enhanced QEPAS technique for CH<sub>4</sub> sensing for the first time to our knowledge. Unlike the commonly used catalyst of water vapor (H<sub>2</sub>O), whose concentration in the air

metadata.title: Acetylene-enhanced methane-QEPAS sensing.
metadata.authors: Sun J; He Y; Qiao S; Zhang C; Ma Y

documents.content: catalyst of water vapor (H<sub>2</sub>O), whose concentration in the air frequently changes and causes fluctuations in both the QEPAS signal level and the characteristics of the quartz tuning fork (QTF), C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub> accelerates CH<sub>4</sub> relaxation without inducing significant

metadata.title: Acetylene-enhanced methane-QEPAS sensing.
metadata.authors: Sun J; He Y; Qiao S; Zhang C; Ma Y

documents.content: accelerates CH<sub>4</sub> relaxation without inducing significant shifts in the QTF frequency. Firstly, the catalytic effect of C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub> molecules on the CH<sub>4</sub> relaxation process was analyzed. Systematic investigations revealed that increasing C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub>

metadata.title: Acetylene-enhanced methane-QEPAS sensing.
metadata.authors: Sun J; He Y; Qiao S; Zhang C; Ma Y

documents.content: investigations revealed that increasing C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub> concentration enhances CH<sub>4</sub>-QEPAS signal intensity in three distinct phases: rapid growth, gradual saturation, and eventual stabilization. At 6000 ppm C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub>, the CH<sub>4</sub>-QEPAS signal amplitude

metadata.title: Acetylene-enhanced methane-QEPAS sensing.
metadata.authors: Sun J; He Y; Qiao S; Zhang C; Ma Y

documents.content: C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub>, the CH<sub>4</sub>-QEPAS signal amplitude increased by 2.53-fold compared to the situation without C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub>. The C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub>-enhanced CH<sub>4</sub>-QEPAS system maintained excellent linearity (R<sup>2</sup> = 0.9999) across

metadata.title: Acetylene-enhanced methane-QEPAS sensing.
metadata.authors: Sun J; He Y; Qiao S; Zhang C; Ma Y

documents.content: system maintained excellent linearity (R<sup>2</sup> = 0.9999) across 1000-12,000 ppm CH<sub>4</sub>. Allan deviation analysis confirmed a minimum detection limit (MDL) of 540 ppb at 1000 s average time, demonstrating excellent long-term stability. This work not only provides a robust strategy for

metadata.title: Acetylene-enhanced methane-QEPAS sensing.
metadata.authors: Sun J; He Y; Qiao S; Zhang C; Ma Y

documents.content: long-term stability. This work not only provides a robust strategy for CH<sub>4</sub> detection but also expands the application of QEPAS in gas relaxation dynamics modulation, highlighting C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub> as a superior relaxation promoter for other molecules with a slow relaxation rate.

metadata.title: Acetylene-enhanced methane-QEPAS sensing.
metadata.authors: Sun J; He Y; Qiao S; Zhang C; Ma Y

documents.content: Deep learning-based computer-generated holography is a promising method for achieving high-quality holographic displays. However, most existing methods are restricted to extracting features from fixed spatial or frequency domains for generating phase-only holograms (POHs), resulting in the loss of

metadata.title: Learnable fractional Fourier transform for high-quality computer-generated holography.
metadata.authors: Liu Q; Chen J; Wang L; Qiu B; Wang Y

documents.content: for generating phase-only holograms (POHs), resulting in the loss of finer details in holographic imaging. To overcome this limitation, we propose a complex-valued fractional Fourier network (CFrFNet) that integrates the fractional Fourier transform (FrFT) within a unified spatial-frequency

metadata.title: Learnable fractional Fourier transform for high-quality computer-generated holography.
metadata.authors: Liu Q; Chen J; Wang L; Qiu B; Wang Y

documents.content: the fractional Fourier transform (FrFT) within a unified spatial-frequency framework to produce high-fidelity POHs. A fractional Fourier neural module (FrFNM) is designed to access arbitrary fractional domains between the spatial and frequency domains after a FrFT. To accommodate the

metadata.title: Learnable fractional Fourier transform for high-quality computer-generated holography.
metadata.authors: Liu Q; Chen J; Wang L; Qiu B; Wang Y

documents.content: between the spatial and frequency domains after a FrFT. To accommodate the characteristics of the fractional domain, a multiscale feature extraction block (MFEB) is proposed to extract rich spatial-frequency joint features. We also introduced a learnable strategy to adaptively optimize the

metadata.title: Learnable fractional Fourier transform for high-quality computer-generated holography.
metadata.authors: Liu Q; Chen J; Wang L; Qiu B; Wang Y

documents.content: We also introduced a learnable strategy to adaptively optimize the fractional order of the FrFT during the training process. Both simulations and experiments validate the effectiveness of our approach, highlighting its potential to significantly enhance the quality of holographic imaging.

metadata.title: Learnable fractional Fourier transform for high-quality computer-generated holography.
metadata.authors: Liu Q; Chen J; Wang L; Qiu B; Wang Y
